Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PMAP-36 (PMAP36, natural AMPs; UCLL1, cathelicidin, pigs, mammals; animals; BBN)

Literature Information.Literature:
Activity: active against Gram- S. typhimurium (MIC 2.5 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 2.5 uM), A. Baumannii (MIC 0.6 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 or PAO1 (MIC 2.5 uM), Gram+ bacteria S. aureus (MIC 20 uM), MRSA (MIC > 40 uM), B. Globigii (MIC 1.25 uM), and  
L. Monocytogenes (MIC 5 uM)  (Pashaie et al., 2025).  In vitro, this peptide retarded DNA migration in the 0.8% agarose gel at ~5 uM (Baumann A et al., 2014.Updated 6/2014; 4/2025.
Literature Information.Author: Zanetti M, Storici P, Tossi A, Scocchi M, Gennaro R.1994
Literature Information.Title: Molecular cloning and chemical synthesis of a novel antibacterial peptide derived from pig myeloid cells.
